Yes, the #MeToo movement has sparked a broader conversation about sexual harassment and abuse in the workplace, and many industries outside of entertainment are taking similar actions to prevent and address these issues. 

For example, many companies and organizations have implemented new policies and procedures to prevent sexual harassment and abuse. This includes training programs for employees, establishing anonymous reporting mechanisms, and creating a culture of support and accountability.

In addition, there have been efforts to increase representation and opportunities for underrepresented groups to prevent discrimination and bias in the workplace. There has been a greater emphasis on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives, such as committing to hiring goals and creating safe and inclusive work environments.

Some industries have also seen a rise in unionization, which can provide workers with greater protections and bargaining power when it comes to addressing workplace harassment and abuse.

Overall, the #MeToo movement has had a significant impact on workplace culture, and many industries are taking steps to create a safer and more equitable environment for all employees.
